original: mos pa'i dbang gis thos pa'i bag chags bskyed pa'i stobs kyis rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bag chags nyam chung bar byed cing rnam par byang ba rgyas par 'gyur ba'o //

translated: By the power of generating the habitual tendencies of listening through the power of interest, the habitual tendencies of affliction that reside in the fruitional consciousness are weakened and the tendencies of purification increase.

translated: The habitual tendencies of interest and listening reside in the mindstream, and with restraint, the afflictions either do not arise or arise weakly.

analyzed: rtogs nas gyur pa ni sar chud pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Realization is that of bodhisattvas who have entered the levels and so on.

original: de kho na dang de kho na yin pa snang ba ste /üîΩbar chad dang bcas pa dang / bar chad med par rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kun du 'byung ba'i phyir de la res 'ga' ni de kho na snang /

analyzed: res 'ga' ni de kho na ma yin pa snang ste /

translated: The transformation is that which is the non-appearance of all signs of the reality realm that has become associated with the obscurations of the knowable, and the appearance of reality.

original: sa bcu pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: sa bcu pa'i bar du'o //

original: 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa ni sgrib pa med pa rnams kyi ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang sgrib pa thams cad kyis sgrib pa med par gyur pa'i mtshan ma thams cad mi snang bar gyur pa dang / sgrib pa thams cad med pa'i phyir de shin tu rnam par dag @274b pa'i de kho na snang ba dang mtshan med dag nyid la dbang thob par gyur ba'i gnas yin te /

translated: The completion of the result is that which is the non-appearance of all signs of the absence of all obscurations, and the attainment of mastery over the appearance of reality, which is extremely pure because of the absence of all obscurations, and over signlessness.

analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan ma la dbang thob pa de nyid kyis ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du sems can gyi don byed do //

original: gyur pa dam pa ni go bla ste /
analyzed: gyur pa dam pa ni go bla ste /

original: bshad pa nyid kyis de bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa nyid kyis de bshad pa yin no //

original: gyur pa rgya che ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gyur pa rgya che ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: de yang yongs su mi gtong ba ni 'khor ba de nyid la zhi bar mthong bas so //

analyzed: gyur pa dman pa'i nyes dmigs ni go bla bsam bshad do //

translated: The benefit of the extensive transformation is that, having attained mastery over all dharmas, one displays all bodies of the same fortune, and through various means, one establishes those who are to be trained in the three vehicles in mundane and supramundane perfections and causes them to realize reality.

original: gnas gyur ba'i skabs nas tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: gnas gyur ba'i skabs nas tshigs su bcad pa /

analyzed: ma rig pa spangs pa'i phyir bdag la ni de kho na nyid snang ste /

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnas gyur pa de nyid thar pa ste /

analyzed: zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: rtag pa'i phyir bskyed pa zhes ni mi brjod do //

analyzed: rnam pa lnga legs par bsgoms pa zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: dper na rdo rjes ni shin tu sra ba gzhig par dka' ba'i rdo rje yang phigs so //

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa sna tshogs kyis gnas zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar chos kyi sku la brten nas gnas pa rnam pa sna tshogs lha dang @278b 'phags pa dang tshangs pa'i gnas pa rnams kyis gnas te /
translated: It is situated in the various Buddha-residences.  In this way, it is situated in the various residences which are based on the Dharma Body, i.e. in the residences of the gods, the noble ones and Brahma.

original: de'i phyir de ni de dag gi gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni de dag gi gnas so //
translated: Therefore, it is the residence of these.

original: de la lha'i gnas pa rnams kyi nang na ni bsam gtan bzhi pa la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams lan mang du gnas pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de la lha'i gnas pa rnams kyi nang na ni bsam gtan bzhi pa la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams lan mang du gnas pa mdzad do //
translated: Among the residences of the gods, the TathƒÅgatas frequently reside in the fourth meditation.

original: 'phags pa'i gnas pa rnams kyi nang na ni stong pa nyid la gnas so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gnas pa rnams kyi nang na ni stong pa nyid la gnas so //
translated: Among the residences of the noble ones, they reside in emptiness.

original: tshangs pa'i gnas pa rnams kyi nang na ni snying rje la gnas so //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas pa rnams kyi nang na ni snying rje la gnas so //
translated: Among the residences of Brahma, they reside in compassion.

original: sna tshogs 'di dag gis nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad par du 'phags so //
analyzed: sna tshogs 'di dag gis nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad par du 'phags so //
translated: By these various means, he is superior to the Sravakas, etc.

original: nyan thos kyi mya ngan las 'das pa las khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi mya ngan las 'das pa las khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate his superiority to the Sravakas in regard to Nirvana, he says:

original: gang phyir sangs rgyas rang gis dbyings brnyes nas //
analyzed: gang phyir sangs rgyas rang gis dbyings brnyes nas //
translated: Since the Buddha, having attained the realm of Dharma,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: etc.

original: rang gi dbyings brnyes zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings brnyes pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi dbyings brnyes zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings brnyes pa'o //
translated: The attainment of the realm of Dharma is the attainment of the realm of Dharma.

original: dga' dang bral zhes bya ba ni nyan thos rnams chos kyi dbyings de ma rnyed pas rnam pa lnga'i bdag nyid kyi dga' ba dang bral te /
analyzed: dga' dang bral zhes bya ba ni nyan thos rnams chos kyi dbyings de ma rnyed pas rnam pa lnga'i bdag nyid kyi dga' ba dang bral te /
translated: Since the Sravakas have not attained that realm of Dharma, they are devoid of the fivefold joy.

original: mgo bcad pa dang 'dra ba'i mya ngan las 'das par mya ngan las 'da' bas dga' ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mgo bcad pa dang 'dra ba'i mya ngan las 'das par mya ngan las 'da' bas dga' ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: They are devoid of joy because they attain Nirvana, which is like having one's head cut off.üîΩTherefore, he says:

original: de'i phyir / de 'dod pas ni de thob byed //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de 'dod pas ni de thob byed //
translated: The one who desires that attains it.

original: ces bya ba ni dga' ba rnam pa lnga 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpas chos kyi dbyings de yang dag par thob par byed do //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni dga' ba rnam pa lnga 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpas chos kyi dbyings de yang dag par thob par byed do //
translated: The Bodhisattva who desires the fivefold joy attains the realm of Dharma.

original: rnam pa lnga'i bdag nyid kyi dga' ba de gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga'i bdag nyid kyi dga' ba de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that joy which has five aspects?üîΩPower, accomplishment of action, taste of Dharma,

original: mthu dang bya ba grub dang chos ro dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mthu dang bya ba grub dang chos ro dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: dga' ba'i rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ba'i rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the causes of joy are differentiated.

original: mthu ni nus pa ste /
analyzed: mthu ni nus pa ste /
translated: Power is ability.

original: de'i dpag tu med pa ni de de bzhin gshegs pa mthu dang ldan pa gang g'a'i klung du ma'i bye ma bgrang ba las 'das pa rnyed kyi chos kyi sku la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i dpag tu med pa ni de de bzhin gshegs pa mthu dang ldan pa gang g'a'i klung du ma'i bye ma bgrang ba las 'das pa rnyed kyi chos kyi sku la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Its immeasurability is the acquisition of the Tathagatas, who are endowed with power, beyond the number of the sands of the Ganges river.

original: thams cad kyang mthu mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyang mthu mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no differentiation in the Dharma Body, since all are equal in power.

original: gang dag la mthu dpag tu med pa mnga' ba de dag la dgyes pa skye'o //
analyzed: gang dag la mthu dpag tu med pa mnga' ba de dag la dgyes pa skye'o //
translated: Joy arises for those who have immeasurable power.

original: dang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: The word and has the sense of including.

original: bya ba ni byed pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba ni byed pa ste /
translated: Action is activity.

original: sems can gyi don te /
analyzed: sems can gyi don te /
translated: It is for the sake of sentient beings.

original: skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du theg pa gsum la 'god pa'o //
analyzed: skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du theg pa gsum la 'god pa'o //
translated: It is the establishment in the three vehicles in accordance with their fortune.

original: de grub pa dpag tu med pa ni dus gsum po dag la yang thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de grub pa dpag tu med pa ni dus gsum po dag la yang thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The accomplishment of that is immeasurable, because it is unobstructed in the three times.

original: de'i phyir mthu dpag tu med pa dang bya ba grub pa dpag tu med pa las dgyes pa skye ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthu dpag tu med pa dang bya ba grub pa dpag tu med pa las dgyes pa skye ba'o //
translated: Therefore, joy arises from the immeasurable power and the immeasurable accomplishment of action.

original: chos kyi ro ni mdo'i sde dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde'i chos dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi ro ni mdo'i sde dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde'i chos dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The taste of Dharma is the Dharma of the Sutras and the melodious narrations.

original: dpag tu med pa ni 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa ni 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is immeasurable because it is mixed.

original: de'i don ni mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos kyis brjod par @279a * //
analyzed: de'i don ni mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos kyis brjod par @279a * //
translated: Its meaning is to be expressed by the Dharma of the Sutras, etc.

original: par bya'o ; ; de'i 'byor pa ni ji ltar yid la byed pa bzhin du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par bya'o ; ; de'i 'byor pa ni ji ltar yid la byed pa bzhin du snang ba'i phyir ro //

original: chos kyi ro dpag tu med pa dang / don 'byor pa dpag tu med pa las dgyes pa skye'o //
analyzed: chos kyi ro dpag tu med pa dang / don 'byor pa dpag tu med pa las dgyes pa skye'o //
translated: Joy arises from the immeasurable taste of the Dharma and the immeasurable wealth of meaning.

original: yon tan rnams ni mngon par shes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan rnams ni mngon par shes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The qualities are the superknowledges, etc.

original: de dag gi 'byor pa dpag tu med pa las dgyes pa skye'o //
analyzed: de dag gi 'byor pa dpag tu med pa las dgyes pa skye'o //
translated: Joy arises from the immeasurable wealth of those.

original: kha cig na re don ni mya ngan las 'das pa'am ji ltar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re don ni mya ngan las 'das pa'am ji ltar 'dod pa'o //
translated: Some say that the meaning is nirvana or whatever is desired.

original: yon tan ni stobs la sogs pa zhe'o //
analyzed: yon tan ni stobs la sogs pa zhe'o //
translated: The qualities are the powers and so on.

original: rtag tu mi zad gzigs pas zhes bya ba ni mthu la sogs pa bdag la yod pa de bzhin nyid dang ro gcig pa de dag nyid mya ngan las 'das par yang yongs su zad pa med par gzigs nas dgyes pa skye'o //
analyzed: rtag tu mi zad gzigs pas zhes bya ba ni mthu la sogs pa bdag la yod pa de bzhin nyid dang ro gcig pa de dag nyid mya ngan las 'das par yang yongs su zad pa med par gzigs nas dgyes pa skye'o //
translated: He sees them as always imperishable, that is, he sees that they are imperishable in nirvana, since they are of the same taste as suchness, which is the identity of his own powers and so on.

original: mchog ni khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog ni khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Supreme means that it transcends the three realms.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is irreproachable, because it abandons the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, together with their traces.

original: chos kyi sku ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i gnas nyid de de yod na kun du ston pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i gnas nyid de de yod na kun du ston pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Dharma Body is the basis of the Enjoyment Body, because the manifestation of the latter occurs when the former exists.

original: de ni nyi ma dang 'od zer gyi tshul lta bu yin no //
analyzed: de ni nyi ma dang 'od zer gyi tshul lta bu yin no //
translated: It is like the relation of the sun and its light.

original: sprul pa'i sku'i gnas zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang de nyid gnas kyi don to //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku'i gnas zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang de nyid gnas kyi don to //
translated: The basis of the Transformation Body is also its basis, since it is the same as the former.

original: phal cher zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mos pas spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phal cher zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mos pas spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase for the most part is for the purpose of including the bodhisattvas who practice with devoted interest.

original: nyan thos rnams ni dman pa la mos pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni dman pa la mos pa ste /
translated: The disciples have devoted interest in the inferior.

original: de dag dang las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sangs rgyas mthong ba med par yongs su smin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag dang las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sangs rgyas mthong ba med par yongs su smin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They and the beginner bodhisattvas do not mature without seeing the Buddha.

original: sa chen por chud pa rnams ni chos zab cing rgya che ba rtogs pa'i phyir sprul pa'i skus yongs su smin par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sa chen por chud pa rnams ni chos zab cing rgya che ba rtogs pa'i phyir sprul pa'i skus yongs su smin par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Those who have entered the great stages are not to be matured by the emanation body, because they have realized the profound and sublime Dharma.

original: bsdus pa ngo bo nyid kyis bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: bsdus pa ngo bo nyid kyis bsdus pa ni /
translated: The summary is the summary of the essence.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said, by the purity of the Buddha qualities.

original: chos kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ston te /
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ston te /
translated: This shows the essence of the Dharma body.

original: chos kyi sku shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sku shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the complete purity of the Dharma body.

original: gang zhig rnam par dag pa'am /
analyzed: gang zhig rnam par dag pa'am /
translated: What is the complete purity?

original: gang zhig gyur pas yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: gang zhig gyur pas yin snyam pa la /
translated: What is the transformation?

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gyur nas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gyur nas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text says, ‚Äúhaving become the foundation consciousness.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi sa bon can de gnyen pos bstsal na yon tan kha na ma tho ba med pa mang po thams cad dang mthun par 'gyur te //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi sa bon can de gnyen pos bstsal na yon tan kha na ma tho ba med pa mang po thams cad dang mthun par 'gyur te //
translated: ‚Äù When that foundation consciousness, which contains the seeds of all afflictions, is transformed by the antidotes, it becomes the foundation consciousness that contains the seeds of all the qualities of enlightenment and is compatible with all the qualities of enlightenment that are free of any negative aspects.

original: dper na sman nang med kyis dug bsal na sman nad med du 'gyur ba bzhin du gyur pa brjod @279b par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na sman nang med kyis dug bsal na sman nad med du 'gyur ba bzhin du gyur pa brjod @279b par bya'o //
translated: This is similar to the way that a medicine called ‚Äúwithout disease‚Äù is used to remove poisons and then becomes a medicine that cures all diseases.üîΩThe root text says, ‚Äúhaving become the consciousness that experiences the results of evolution.

original: rnam par smin pas zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis bsdus zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pas zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis bsdus zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚Äù This is to be connected with the phrase ‚Äúhaving become the qualities of enlightenment.üîΩ‚Äù The root text says, ‚Äúhaving become the sense faculties such as the eyes.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po gyur nas zhes bya ba ni de dag rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po gyur nas zhes bya ba ni de dag rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äù This is because those sense faculties are the results of evolution.

original: de gyur pa yang sngon byung ba'i tshul gyis rnam par smin pa nyid du gnas te /
analyzed: de gyur pa yang sngon byung ba'i tshul gyis rnam par smin pa nyid du gnas te /
translated: And that transformation remains the results of evolution in the same way that it was previously.

original: sngon byung ba'i tshul nyid kyis rnam par smin pa'i ye shes thob bo //
analyzed: sngon byung ba'i tshul nyid kyis rnam par smin pa'i ye shes thob bo //
translated: By means of that very process of becoming, the knowledge of the results of evolution is attained.üîΩThe root text says, ‚Äúhaving become the support.üîΩ‚Äù This is to be connected with the phrase ‚Äúhaving become the qualities of enlightenment.

original: gnas pas zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pas zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy abiding‚Äù means by being included within the qualities of a buddha.

original: 'dod pa la spyod pa la sogs pa la gnas gyur nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni mos pas spyod pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la spyod pa la sogs pa la gnas gyur nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni mos pas spyod pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase having transformed the abodes of the desire realm, etc., includes the stage of action in faith, etc.

original: de gyur pas gnas pa'i ye shes 'thob bo //
analyzed: de gyur pas gnas pa'i ye shes 'thob bo //
translated: By that transformation, one attains the intuition of abiding.

original: ye shes tshad med pas gnas pa thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gis lha la sogs pa'i gnas pa sna tshogs rnams kyis gnas so //üîΩdbang 'byor bas sa ni yongs su 'dzin pa'i las sna tshogs gyur nas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten na zhing las dang chod la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i las sna tshogs gang yin pa de gyur nas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du thogs pa med
analyzed: ye shes tshad med pas gnas pa thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gis lha la sogs pa'i gnas pa sna tshogs rnams kyis gnas so // dbang 'byor bas sa ni yongs su 'dzin pa'i las sna tshogs gyur nas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten na zhing las dang chod la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i las sna tshogs gang yin pa de gyur nas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du thogs pa med
translated: Because one attains the abiding of immeasurable intuition, by which one abides in the various abodes of the gods, etc.

original: pa'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes 'thob bo //
analyzed: pa'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes 'thob bo //
translated: By the transformation of the various activities of worldly abodes, such as agriculture and commerce, one attains the intuition of unobstructed superknowledge in all world spheres.

original: tha snyad pas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten na mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad gang yin pa de dag gyur nas mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs pa la dbang 'byor ba thob ste /
analyzed: tha snyad pas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten na mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad gang yin pa de dag gyur nas mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs pa la dbang 'byor ba thob ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving become conventional‚Äù means that having become whatever conventions are seen in the world, he attains mastery over seeing, hearing, and so on.

original: des sems can thams cad kyi sems tshim par byed pa'i ye shes thob bo //
analyzed: des sems can thams cad kyi sems tshim par byed pa'i ye shes thob bo //
translated: By means of that, he attains the intuition that satisfies the minds of all sentient beings.

original: sel babs zhes bya ba ni gang 'jig rten na mdza' bo dang nor gyi stobs kyis rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor ba la sogs pa nas byung ba'i gnod pa zhi bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: sel babs zhes bya ba ni gang 'jig rten na mdza' bo dang nor gyi stobs kyis rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor ba la sogs pa nas byung ba'i gnod pa zhi bar byed pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving become the removal of fear‚Äù means that by the power of his wealth and friends, he removes the harm that arises in the world from the king‚Äôs court and so on.

original: de gyur nas sems can thams cad kyi gnod pa thams cad zhi bar byed pa'i ye shes 'thob bo //
analyzed: de gyur nas sems can thams cad kyi gnod pa thams cad zhi bar byed pa'i ye shes 'thob bo //
translated: Having become that, he attains the intuition that removes all the harm of all sentient beings.

original: rnam pa drug po 'di dag gyur pas sangs rgyas kyi chos drug 'thob bo //
analyzed: rnam pa drug po 'di dag gyur pas sangs rgyas kyi chos drug 'thob bo //
translated: By becoming these six, he attains the six qualities of the Buddha.

original: gnas dang dgongs pa dang phrin las tha dad pa med pa gsum gyis sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi sku dbyer med do //
analyzed: gnas dang dgongs pa dang phrin las tha dad pa med pa gsum gyis sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi sku dbyer med do //
translated: The three non-differentiation of abode, intention, and action show the non-differentiation of the Dharma Body of all Buddhas.

original: gnas tha dad pa med pa ni de bzhin nyid tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas tha dad pa med pa ni de bzhin nyid tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no difference in their realm, because their realm is the ultimate realm.

original: dgongs pa tha dad pa med pa ni thams cad kyang phan pa dang bde bar dgongs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩphrin las tha dad pa med pa ni thams cad kyang 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa'i phyir te /üîΩmngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang yongs su mya ngan las @280a * //

translated: There is no difference in their intention, because they are all intent on benefit and happiness.

original: 'das pa ston pa'i phrin las can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa ston pa'i phrin las can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no difference in their activity, because they all perform the activity of teaching, demonstrating perfect enlightenment and final cessation.

original: lus tshad med pa mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par bya ba'i phyir tha dad pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar lus gzhan dang gzhan tshad med pa rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: lus tshad med pa mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par bya ba'i phyir tha dad pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar lus gzhan dang gzhan tshad med pa rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ste /
translated: They are said to be different because of the infinite bodies of the buddhas, because the bodhisattvas are enlightened by means of infinite bodies.

original: de'i phyir tha dad pa med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, they are not undifferentiated.

original: ji skad du sngar /
analyzed: ji skad du sngar /
translated: As it was said earlier:

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because there is no grasping of self,

original: gnas pa tha dad yod ma yin //üîΩsngon gyi rjes su 'brang bas na //
analyzed: gnas pa tha dad yod ma yin // sngon gyi rjes su 'brang bas na //
translated: There is no difference in their abiding.üîΩThey are distinguished by their designations,

original: de la gdags pas tha dad byed //üîΩces bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la gdags pas tha dad byed // ces bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: following the former.

original: de bzhin du gnyis pa la yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis pa la yang brjod par bya ste /

original: de gnyis kyi gnas ni chos kyi sku yin la /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi gnas ni chos kyi sku yin la /

original: dgongs pa dang phrin las dag kyang tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: dgongs pa dang phrin las dag kyang tha dad pa med do //

original: tha dad pa 'di ni 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gzhan no //
analyzed: tha dad pa 'di ni 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gzhan no //

original: 'di ni gzhan no zhes bya ba dang / 'di ni sh'akya thub pa'o //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtsol ba tsam gyis dus gsum gyi shes bya'i dngos po thams cad rtogs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtsol ba tsam gyis dus gsum gyi shes bya'i dngos po thams cad rtogs te /

original: de lta bas na de dag ni sngas rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag ni sngas rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ces bya'o //

original: rnam pa'i mchog thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni lung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams la yod pa'i rnam pa'i mchog thams cad mkhyen pa ste de'i ngo bo'o //

translated: The knowledge of all the modes is the knowledge of all the modes that exist in the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields. It is the essence of that.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku la gnas pa'i yon tan thun mong ma yin pa rnam par 'grel pa 'dir bstod pa'i sgo mas  tshigs su sbyar ba byas te /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku la gnas pa'i yon tan thun mong ma yin pa rnam par 'grel pa 'dir bstod pa'i sgo mas  tshigs su sbyar ba byas te /

original: des yon tan 'di dag rnam par 'grel to //
analyzed: des yon tan 'di dag rnam par 'grel to //

original: sems can rnams la thugs brtse ba //
analyzed: sems can rnams la thugs brtse ba //

original: zhes bya ba ni tshad med pa bzhi bo dag snying brtse ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshad med pa bzhi bo dag snying brtse ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir bshad pa'o //

analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i dus na bde ba dang phrad par shog cig ces pa'i bsam pa ni byams pa'o //

analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi dus na de dang bral bar shog cig pa'i bsam pa ni snying rje'o //

analyzed: bde ba'i dus na de dang mi 'bral bar shog cig pa'i bsam pa ni dga' ba'o //

original: dgongs pa can zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa can zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //

analyzed: bde ba dang phan dgongs pa zhes bya ba nyid btang snyoms te / btang snyoms ni brtul ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /

original: gzhan dag gi nyon mongs pa mi skye bar bya ba'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i bsam pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi nyon mongs pa mi skye bar bya ba'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i bsam pa'i mtshan nyid do //

original: gang gi phyir khyod nyid yon tan yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyod nyid yon tan yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since you are yourself the virtues,

original: khyod la phyag 'tshal lo zhes phyag 'tshal ba thams cad dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: khyod la phyag 'tshal lo zhes phyag 'tshal ba thams cad dang sbyar ro //

original: sgrib pa kun las nges par grol //
analyzed: sgrib pa kun las nges par grol //

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa las byung ba lta bu'i rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad dang / zad bar gyi skye ba ched bcu ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa las byung ba lta bu'i rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad dang / zad bar gyi skye ba ched bcu ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The eight liberations, the eight spheres of mastery, and the ten spheres of totality do not exist in the way they are found in the Sravakayana.

original: rnam par gzhag pa 'dir ni rnam par @282b thar zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched rnams kyi sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //

original: nyon mongs pa med pa ni kun rdzob kyi mkhyen pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa ni kun rdzob kyi mkhyen pa'i bdag nyid do //

original: de'i khyad par du byed de /
analyzed: de'i khyad par du byed de /

original: sangs rgyas ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni de lta ma yin te /

original: de ni nyon mongs pa skye yang skal pa yod pa rnams 'dul bar gzigs /
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa skye yang skal pa yod pa rnams 'dul bar gzigs /

original: gshegs nas nyon mongs pa 'dul te /üîΩde ni / sems can kun gyi nyon mongs kun //
analyzed: gshegs nas nyon mongs pa 'dul te / de ni / sems can kun gyi nyon mongs kun //
translated: Having gone there, he subdues the afflictions.üîΩThis is related by the verse:üîΩHe is the one who completely

analyzed: sangs rgyas ni de ltar ma yin te / de ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ngo //
translated: The Buddha is not like that.üîΩHe abandons all afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa sel ba yin gyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa sel ba yin gyi /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa can spong ba ni ma yin zhing nyon mongs pa can rnams la rtag tu thugs brtse ba dang bcas pa ste /

analyzed: nyon mongs zin pa'i skye bo'i ched du khyod ni bzhugs par 'gyur // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //

analyzed: sangs rgyas ni de lta ma yin te /

analyzed: bsgrim mi dgos par lhun gyis grub par mkhyen pas nor bu dang sil snyan bzhin no //
translated: They know spontaneously without effort, like a jewel or a musical instrument.

original: shes par bya ba mkhyen par gyur zin pas mkhyen pa la chags pa mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: shes par bya ba mkhyen par gyur zin pas mkhyen pa la chags pa mi mnga' ste /
translated: They are not attached to their knowledge, because they have already known what was to be known.

analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa'i phyir ro // shes bya'i @283a * //
translated: because the afflictive obstructions together with their traces have been abandoned.üîΩThe knowledge of the buddhas is unobstructed with regard to the knowable,

analyzed: sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir mkhyen pa thogs pa mi mnga'o //

analyzed: de ni gnyis kyis bshad par bya ba yin pas ston pa gnyis te /

original: tshig dang / shes pa ste /
analyzed: tshig dang / shes pa ste /

analyzed: ngag kun du slong bar byed pa'i phyir ro // de dag la blo gros mi thogs pa ni mkhyen pa ldog pa med pa'o //

analyzed: de la gnas pa blo gros thogs pa med pa ni /
translated: The absence of obstruction to the intellect with regard to those is the unobstructed knowledge of the dhƒÅtus.üîΩThe absence of obstruction to the intellect with regard to the bases is the unobstructed knowledge of the bases.

analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnam par 'byed pa'i tshigs su bcas pa ni /

analyzed: de dag gi tshig rnams kyis legs par 'doms zhes bya ba ni lha'i rna ba'i @283b mngon par shes pas 'gro ba thams cad pa'i 'dul pa rnams kyis smras pa'i sgra don dang ldan pa'i rgyang ring po yang gnas nas ji ltar mthun par chos ston pa'i phyir
translated: Their words are well-instructive, because, with the superknowledge of the divine ear, he teaches the Dharma appropriately, even from a distance, with words that are meaningful to all beings who are to be guided.

analyzed: ro // spyod pa mkhyen nas legs par 'doms //

analyzed: 'ongs pa la legs par 'doms zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa ste /

original: stong pa nyid dang / smin pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa zhes bya ba'i gnas pas mi dge ba'i chos la dmigs nas bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmi dang ngan song ba rnams la yang bdag nyid dang bzhugs pa mchog rnams yin te /

original: tshangs spyod ma yin chos rnams la yang bdag nyid dang bzhugs pa mchog rnams yin te /
analyzed: tshangs spyod ma yin chos rnams la yang bdag nyid dang bzhugs pa mchog rnams yin te /

analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi zhes bya ba'i tshangs pa'i gnas pas de la dmigs nas bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
